availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Power (Magoffin County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Floyd County, Kentucky, native. Married to Nancy Williams Power in Morgan County, Kentucky, on August 15, 1831. Father of Elizabeth Power, Sarah J. Power, Sanford Power, Mason H. Power, Mary Power, Rebecca Power, and Nancy Power. Farmer in Floyd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Floyd County in 1850. Farmer in Magoffin County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Magoffin County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from December 10, 1861, to February 6, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 454A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 529.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, p. 466.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, p. 476A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Morgan County Marriages, Film 000839918, p. 19.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 278.
